comments: If one of the connectors fails to load the task list will be cleared, and need to be restored from backup.

no sure whether that belongs here. but sometimes after a workspace crash e.g. killing Eclipse the task list view is empty and I need to restart Eclipse so that the task list appears again. There is an exception logged for Plug-in org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist with message "startup class must implement org.eclipse.ui.IStartup" but no stack trace.

this is on linux

The exception in comment#2 is a result of the task list not being initailized.  However, comment#1 indicates a race condition at startup that we need to get to the bottom of.  This cryptic message indicates a failure in MylarTaskListPlugin.earlyStartup().  Are you customizing or extending the Task List in any way?  Which Eclipse version/configuration are you using?  

This evening's dev build will have some additional error handing that might give us additional clues.

This will have to wait until 0.7 since we are likely to simplify externalization.  For the time being I have updated the FAQ that if an uninstall of a connector was done accidentally a restore will need to be performed.

Rob, is it possible to do the same approach that you took with storing repositories.xml, i.e. hold on to the elements that could not be parsed with the available externalizers in a String, then write them out identically?
Sounds reasonable, I'll look into it.
